fine_dining.name: Azurmendi
signature_dishes: Truffled Egg Yolk with Carbonated Herb Consommé
Roasted Lobster with Wild Herb Infusion
fine_dining.atmosphere: Stunning eco-sustainable glass pavilion surrounded by countryside with gardens and greenhouse
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book 2-3 months in advance, especially for weekend dining
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef Eneko Atxa's dining experience begins with a tour through different spaces; request the kitchen tour option

fine_dining.name: Nerua
signature_dishes: Garden of Vegetables with Local Herbs
fine_dining.atmosphere: Minimalist, elegant dining room within the Guggenheim Museum with views of the Nervión River
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve at least 1 month in advance, closed Monday and Sunday evening
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef Josean Alija focuses on purity of flavors; their seasonally changing tasting menu offers the best experience

fine_dining.name: Etxanobe Atelier
signature_dishes: Sea Urchin with Cauliflower and Truffle
fine_dining.atmosphere: Sophisticated dining space with contemporary art and open kitchen
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book 3-4 weeks in advance, closed Sunday and Monday
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef Fernando Canales combines traditional Basque ingredients with modern techniques; their cheese selection is outstanding

fine_dining.name: Mina
fine_dining.atmosphere: Intimate, converted warehouse with industrial elements and open kitchen counter seating
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve 3-4 weeks ahead, request counter seats for kitchen views
fine_dining.local_tips: Chefs Álvaro Garrido and Lara Martín offer creative tasting menus that change constantly; wine pairings showcase small Spanish producers

fine_dining.name: Zortziko
signature_dishes: Hake with Kokotxas in Green Sauce
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant belle époque dining room in a historic building with classical décor
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book 2 weeks ahead, closed Sunday evening and Monday
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef Daniel García is a master of traditional Basque haute cuisine; excellent for business dinners with the menu ejecutivo

casual_dining.name: La Viña del Ensanche
casual_dining.atmosphere: Classic Basque tavern with marble bar, hanging hams, and lively ambiance
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book for sit-down meals; bar area accepts walk-ins for pintxos
casual_dining.local_tips: Over 100 years old; famous for their hand-carved jamón and extensive Spanish wine selection

casual_dining.name: Gure Toki
signature_dishes: Foie with Apple and Pedro Ximénez Reduction
casual_dining.atmosphere: Contemporary tavern in historic square with outdoor seating
casual_dining.booking_tips: No reservations for bar; arrive early evenings to avoid crowds
casual_dining.local_tips: Award-winning creative pintxos; order hot pintxos from the menu rather than just selecting from the bar

casual_dining.name: Bascook
signature_dishes: Octopus with Sweet Potato and Kimchi
casual_dining.atmosphere: Industrial-chic restaurant in former warehouse with contemporary design
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book several days ahead, especially for weekends
casual_dining.local_tips: Chef Aitor Elizegi creates globally-influenced Basque cuisine; daily menú del día offers excellent value for high-quality cooking

casual_dining.name: El Perro Chico
signature_dishes: Slow-cooked Egg with Mushrooms and Truffle
Bacalao al Pilpil (Cod in Garlic-Olive Oil Emulsion)
casual_dining.atmosphere: Cozy tavern with rustic-modern décor in historic building
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book for lunch; dinner usually accommodates walk-ins
casual_dining.local_tips: Named after the historic narrow street it's located on; good mix of traditional and modern Basque cuisine

casual_dining.name: Momatxo
casual_dining.atmosphere: Bright, modern bistro with open kitchen and minimalist design
casual_dining.local_tips: Off the tourist path with fantastic daily market menu based on what was fresh that morning

casual_dining.name: Zarate
casual_dining.atmosphere: Modern, understated dining room with focus on the food
casual_dining.booking_tips: Reserve for weekend lunches at least a week ahead
casual_dining.local_tips: Chef Sergio Ortiz de Zarate is a master with seafood; fish is cooked in front of diners on a wood-fired grill

casual_dining.name: Bistró Guggenheim
casual_dining.atmosphere: Sleek, design-forward space within the iconic museum
casual_dining.booking_tips: Reserve for lunch after museum visit; special entry package available
casual_dining.local_tips: More casual alternative to Nerua in the same building; perfect for lunch after visiting the museum

street_food.name: Mercado de la Ribera Pintxo Bars
street_food.local_tips: Europe's largest covered market houses several pintxo bars; try traditional Gildas, named after Rita Hayworth's character

street_food.name: Casco Viejo Pintxo Crawl
street_food.local_tips: Thursday evening is 'pintxo-pote' night when many bars offer a pintxo and drink at reduced prices

street_food.name: El Globo
street_food.local_tips: Historic churro establishment; locals come after dinner for late-night churros con chocolate

street_food.name: Café Iruña
street_food.local_tips: Historic café with Moorish-influenced décor; their bocadillo de tortilla (Spanish omelette sandwich) is perfect for a quick lunch

street_food.name: La Campa de los Ingleses Market
street_food.local_tips: Rotating weekend food market with varied international options; great riverside setting next to the Guggenheim

coffee_shops.name: La Marzocco Café
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Contemporary, minimalist café with focus on coffee quality
coffee_shops.food_options: Artisanal pastries and light breakfast items
coffee_shops.local_tips: The pioneer of specialty coffee in Bilbao; baristas compete internationally

coffee_shops.name: Bihotz Café
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Rustic-industrial space with vintage elements and local art
coffee_shops.local_tips: Transforms from café to craft beer bar in the evening; hosts coffee cupping sessions monthly

coffee_shops.name: Mami Lou
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Cozy, French-inspired café with vintage furnishings
coffee_shops.food_options: Full breakfast menu and French pastries
coffee_shops.local_tips: All pastries made in-house; great for traditional European breakfast

coffee_shops.name: El Cafetín
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Classic Spanish café with traditional décor and local clientele
coffee_shops.local_tips: Where locals start their day; excellent traditional breakfast with tomato toast and olive oil

coffee_shops.name: Cafetería Sainz
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Traditional Bilbao café with marble tables and classic ambiance
coffee_shops.food_options: Full selection of traditional Basque pastries
coffee_shops.local_tips: Family-owned since 1962; famous for traditional Bilbao pastries like Carolinas and Rusos

bars.name: El Txikito
bars.atmosphere: Classic Basque tavern with long bar filled with pintxos and lively ambiance
bars.local_tips: Watch the theatrical pouring of txakoli wine from height to create aeration; pair with anchovies

bars.name: La Viña del Ensanche
bars.atmosphere: Classic tavern with walls lined with bottles and hanging hams
bars.food_options: Premium ibérico ham and aged cheeses
bars.local_tips: Over 200 Spanish wines available; the house vermouth on tap is exceptional

bars.name: Singular
signature_drinks: Bilbao Sour (Patxaran-based twist on whiskey sour)
bars.atmosphere: Sophisticated cocktail bar with art deco elements and intimate lighting
bars.local_tips: The mixologists create Basque-inspired cocktails using local ingredients like patxaran (sloe liqueur)

bars.name: Residence
bars.atmosphere: Modern rooftop terrace with panoramic city views
bars.local_tips: The best sunset views in Bilbao; each gin & tonic is served with specific botanicals and premium tonics

bars.name: Pub Lamiak
bars.atmosphere: Laid-back beer bar with rustic elements and friendly ambiance
bars.local_tips: Named after mythological Basque creatures; offers the best selection of local craft beers in Bilbao

bars.name: Café Iruña
bars.atmosphere: Stunning Moorish-inspired historic café with ornate tiles and vintage charm
bars.local_tips: Operating since 1903 with largely unchanged décor; the afternoon vermouth hour is a Bilbao tradition

food_tours.name: Pintxos Crawl in Casco Viejo
highlights: Guided tour of Old Town's best pintxo bars
Introduction to txakoli wine and cider pouring
food_tours.booking_tips: Book at least a week in advance; tours explain the culture and etiquette of pintxo dining

food_tours.name: Mercado de la Ribera Gastro Tour
highlights: Guided tour of Europe's largest covered market
Tasting of Basque cheeses, charcuterie, and wines
food_tours.booking_tips: Morning tours recommended when market is most active; comfortable shoes suggested

food_tours.name: Rioja Alavesa Wine Region Day Trip
highlights: Visits to traditional and modern wineries
Traditional Riojan lunch at a bodega
food_tours.booking_tips: Book 10-14 days ahead; includes transportation from Bilbao to nearby wine region

food_tours.name: Basque Cider House Experience
highlights: Traditional cider house menu with cider poured from large barrels
food_tours.booking_tips: Seasonal (January-April is traditional cider season); includes transportation to nearby cider region

cooking_classes.name: Basque Pintxos Workshop
includes: All ingredients, recipes, pintxo lunch with wine
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Reserve 1-2 weeks ahead; takes place in a professional teaching kitchen

cooking_classes.name: Bacalao al Pil Pil Masterclass
what_you_learn: Creating the Perfect Pil Pil Sauce Emulsion
includes: All ingredients, recipe booklet, full meal with wine pairings
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Book at least 10 days in advance; focuses on the iconic Basque cod preparation

cooking_classes.name: Basque Desserts & Pastries Class
includes: All materials, recipes, dessert sampling with coffee and digestifs
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Book 1 week ahead; suitable for all skill levels

markets.name: Mercado de la Ribera
highlights: Fresh seafood, produce, meats, and cheeses
Pintxo bars and restaurants on ground floor
markets.hours: Monday to Friday 8:00 AM - 2:30 PM and 5:00 PM - 7:00 PM, Saturday 8:00 AM - 3:00 PM
markets.local_tips: The fish section is particularly impressive; ground floor restaurants serve the same fresh products found upstairs

markets.name: Mercado del Ensanche
highlights: Upscale indoor market with premium products
markets.hours: Monday to Friday 9:00 AM - 8:00 PM, Saturday 9:00 AM - 3:00 PM
markets.local_tips: More upscale than La Ribera with specialty and imported products; good place to find souvenirs like premium olive oils and wines

markets.name: Sunday Rastro Market
markets.local_tips: Beyond food, offers antiques and collectibles; surrounded by pintxo bars for post-shopping refreshment

winter: Bacalao al Pil Pil (Salt Cod with Garlic Sauce)
Txipirones en su Tinta (Squid in Ink Sauce)
